Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: LeVagabonde
Reviews.Content: Classy, and best value in DFW. Of all the places that I've stayed in Dallas, the others don't hold a candle to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff and Hotel smells Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: bigred1972
Reviews.Content: First thing you need to do is join Omni loyalty. With this you receive complimentory WiFi, Two free bottles of water a day, Newspaper delivered to your room, Free press on two garments, and a free beverage order delivered to your room in the morning. Great stay went downhill from the start. The doormen are great, Front desk associate was very friendly, room was nice. Now the bad, Dog barking very loud, had to call down and complain, dog had not been checked in. Second WiFi did not work second day, had to complain. Beds were not very comfortable at all, very firm! The final jump downhill was the final morning and a Airline pilot walked in my room, they had booked my room and it was an hour from checkout time, again I had a visit with the manger this time. I really wonder if this Hotel has everthing together, to many mistakes to be accidents. The manager did comp my second night stay which was the right thing for her to do. We have stayed at this Hotel three times and this was the worst stay of the three.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull attentive staff combined with a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SouthernTravel
Reviews.Content: I attended a small conference at the Dallas Omni. This recently renovated hotel is georgious. The staff and management did everything possible to ensure our conference was perfect! Lots of TLC. Food and beverage operation was excellent! This is where you want to stay, dine, relax, and entertain.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive first stay”
Reviews.Author: NicholasTheGreek
Reviews.Content: Check-in process was smooth. Had a king room on the 6th floor, which was very spacious. The bathroom had many amenities. Since I arrived at the hotel after the restaurant closed, I sat at the bar any ordered. Food was very good. Restaurant was busy on Saturday morning and had to wait a few minutes for a table. Buffet was plentiful and includes made-to-order omelets. Or you can order off the menu.The gym was big and had elliptical machines, treadmills, stationary bikes and weights (machines and free). There is free covered parking. The staff is very friendly. If I had to find any cons, it was that I had problems connecting to wifi, but it wasn't important on this trip. Note that there is a fee for wifi if you are not a loyalty member. Also, had to laugh after showering because the towel rack was on the other side of the bathroom. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to the Omni on Park West!”
Reviews.Author: VinaMike
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions. Each time the staff has been friendly, helpful and welcoming. The rooms are clean, comfortable and conveniently laid out. Great food too, at reasonable prices. The hotel is sort of away from everything else, so its ideal for 'getting away from it all' and for keeping business conference attendees focused. There ia a courtesy shuttle, and malls, restaurants etc fall within its range. It is also conveniently located fairly close to the airport (DFW).

Reviews.Title: “Another fantastic stay at the Omni Park West”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: I was really upset with the Omni chain after a visit to San Antonio in October so I am very happy to say that it is all about Management. I stay at this location at least twice per year and each time they do not disappoint. I am going to say that the SA location needs to really pay attention to this location because just because the chain opened a new location in Dallas the quality of customer service in this branch has been consistently fantastic every time. We went for a quick morning jog and when we got back we were greeted and offered water as soon as we hit the lobby area which is always a nice touch. The hotel is conveniently located by the interstate and even with all of the construction in the city this is still the best location for shopping and entertainment. The hot chocolate in this location is the best. The service is also fantastic. The staff is attentive and friendly. The free self parking still makes this location more desirable than the new Dallas Omni that is in the downtown area. We did drive by the new hotel and it is impressive I just hate to add parking to a stay. For this visit we stayed in a room near the elevator. It wasn't too noisy because we were in the higher floors.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly and attentive staff.”
Reviews.Author: scooterbunny
Reviews.Content: I was here for a conference and stayed for 5 days/nights. All of the staff was very helpful, friendly and attentive. The hotel is very nice, clean and very well maintained. The room was very comfortable and clean. Comfortable king bed, desk and chair with ottoman. Nice bathroom with everything you need. Great breakfast and lunch and snacks which were included with our conference. Love the staff here.....they really know how to take care of a guest.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: JulissaC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Omni for All-Star Weekend 2010. Overall, the hotel was great. Our room was comfortably sized and very clean and the staff was helpful and kind. Another plus was the hotel's breakfast, which was delicious and inexpensive. The only con about staying here is that it is a bit far from downtown Dallas. Unless you are renting a car, you will spend a lot of money getting to town and back.

Reviews.Title: “want to send a postcard?”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: i went to the hotel shop to buy some postcards to mail to Europe; no they dont sell postage stamps but the young lady kindly rang through to the front desk .. yes we have one (yes just one) but sadly for the USA only. 'It's because people keep buying them' she said An the free shuttle bus wil take you 5 miles in any direction ... not far enough to get to a Shopping Mall

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays ever”
Reviews.Author: greggtex
Reviews.Content: Wife wanted a local getaway for the wkend. The Omni had a great overall rating and a super rate as well. It was great! EVERY single staff member not only spoke and smiled, but made eye contact like they really cared about you. Cleanliness was beyond reproach. Amenities are top notch. We have paid less for a clean, nice hotel stay, but we also got less, much less. We got an in-house restaurant, seperate men's/women's locker room, sauna, a large, so relaxing heated whrilpool, a great fitness center, and a clean, large room to spend the night. By joining their Select Guest Loyalty program, we each got a free drink delievered to our room in the morning also! Free wi-fi also came with that. All for a base rate of $89! Few places can you find the amenities and quality for that price. We will definitely be going back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Greater Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: francis54
Reviews.Content: A top-notch property! Not new - but up-to-date w/ a heated pool, wonderful indoor hot tub and steam/sauna. Quiet, comfortable rooms and beds - and a helpful staff. Spring for the bed & breakfast special. You won't be disappointed with the buffet selections, omelette station, fresh breads and fruits, the service or the Starbucks. We usually stay downtown when we travel - but that was not possible this round. We chose well - and the self-parking is free. Sign-up for Omni's free rewards program. With it you get free in-room wifi and free coffee and newspaper delivered to your door each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel”
Reviews.Author: JDMichigan
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at this hotel for a business conference. Staff was very friendly. We were able to check in at 11:00, rather than the 3:00 standard check-in time. Very close to the DFW airport. Enjoyed the fireplaces throughout the hotel. Pool area was very nice. Everything was very clean. Concierge steered us to not-so-great restaurants, but we were sure to ask other locals and received good advice on where to dine. Be sure to sign up for the free rewards program before checking in, so that you can take advantage of the free internet in your room, bottled water, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Ommniii?... (sigh)”
Reviews.Author: XLTdryvr
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at any Omni was 2008 at Las Colinas, it was nice. This hotel Iâ€˜d say not as nice, but okay. I always assumed Omniâ€™s were chic or elegant. Both places hosted our company holiday party so I must say I enjoyed my stay. Valet was very polite and prompt (not sure what the cost is normally, it was included in our rate). Check-in was fast and we made it to the room with no trouble. The ballroom was lovely, we had our own DJ but the hotel staff did a fabulous job with dÃ©cor, food and service. I felt safe leaving my clutch at the table while I snapped photos and took â€˜partialâ€™ use of the dance floor. My boss had an awesome hospitality suite. Back to our roomâ€¦ I donâ€™t think itâ€™s too much to expect a pleasant scent when walking into a place like this. I didnâ€™t get a pleasant scent at all. The bathroom was just inside the door and had a slight sewage smell. I just canâ€™t get used to the Texas water. Next, itâ€™s disgusting to see someone elseâ€™s hair. Rather than a dirty BR, I want to assume the strands were left behind by the maid. One plus about this room is even though it hugged the elevator, I was never disturbed by any sounds. I loved how you walk in and see a bed, but walk ahead and turn the corner thereâ€™s a hidden sitting area! A very nice touch to the suite, create a separation. The bed was very comfortable. Room service was delicious, the attendant even commented on how good my lotions smelled when she walked in (THATâ€™S WHAT I WANT TO EXPERIENCE).

Reviews.Title: “Not as impressive as it appears”
Reviews.Author: courtney h
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my two kids so that I could attend a business meeting and we chose to stay at this hotel because of the high recommendations. We had to wait 45 minutes past check in time to get our room, and you know that isn't all too convenient when you have an 8 week old baby and a 4 yr old with you. They had said the rooms were not ready. While the room was beautiful and accomodating, it was not very clean. There were fingerprints and smudges all over the glass table tops like they hadn't been wiped down. Having such a small baby cleanliness was definitely a concern so I asked housekeeping (that I saw in the hall) to go back down and wipe the tabletops off or if they would just give me some disinfectant wipes. She couldn't speak english so she walked into our hotel room, walked into the bathroom and back out. Clearly she had no idea what I meant and didn't know what she was doing. The rest of our short stay at this hotel was not problematic. Room was quiet. Everything went smooth with check out. However, two days after our trip, I check my bank account and notice an additional charge from this hotel for $55. Upon calling the hotel I am told that it is for numerous items in the mini bar/fridge. Which makes me obviously furious to see because we did not even touch the mini bar. I am not going to be drinking alcohol with my two kids in my presence not would i have purchased any of the snacks because it is so pricey. I do have a call in to the hotel to dispute this charge. The hotel has told me that the housekeeping made the note in their computer of these items missing from the fridge. I am furious. Because of this incident and the poor job housekeeping does with cleaning, we would not stay at this hotel again. Especially for the price you are paying for luxurious accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Dallas hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpwoodfin
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel located in north Dallas. It is conveniently located near DFW. The rooms are comfortable and the staff is great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you don't look too closely or like cleanliness.”
Reviews.Author: Hotel12345
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni for work in January. The staff and lobby are very nice, but once I got in my room my opinions changed. There was hair all over the bathroom. I had a room with 2 beds, and there was hair IN the first bed I pulled back. I had already unpacked and didn't want to change rooms. Thankfully the second bed looked clean, but neither bed had its flat sheet tucked in. I expected a lot more from an Omni property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvsmacca65
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 8 nights while attending a training class. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. From the moment I walked in until I checked out I was treated like a vip. The staff is outstanding! They were all calling me by name within an hour of my arrival! The bar and restaurant staff went out of their way to give great service and the food is very good. Room service was delivered very quickly! The rooms are very comfortable and immaculate. Turn down service is offered but I did not have it. They still brought me ice and water every night and a breakfast beverage each morning. I did not use the spa or gym but did have a peek and the facilities looked good. It was too cold to swim but the pool looked nice to me. The only downside to this hotel is the location and if you have a car, that is not an issue. Since I did not, I felt a little isolated, although the hotel does provide free shuttle service to anywhere within about a 5 mile radius. Over all a great choice and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Nice”
Reviews.Author: GoNext
Reviews.Content: I appreciate the clean beddings and pillows in the cozy room. I also enjoyed the spas. However, I did not use the outdoor swimming pool that appears dirty and unchlorinated. The hotel is not within the close proximity to Downtown Dallas. Nevertheless, I would recommend this Omni Dallas Park West for the quality and clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shaz_aussie39
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night before our flight home to Australia and were very surprised at the value for money of this very nice hotel. Rooms were spacious and comfortable and the food in the restaurant was excellent value. I can't comment too much on the location as it was chosen for closeness to the airport and the great price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as always.”
Reviews.Author: KSinSBC
Reviews.Content: Have probably stayed here over a dozen times in the past six years or so. Every single time, the staff is on point, the bar food is good, the room is spotless and request are met with a smile. How each hotel experience should be.

Reviews.Title: “Service is great!”
Reviews.Author: Carolmil
Reviews.Content: The service at Omni is great! From the front desk to the valet attendant. The hallways are quiet, and it's not too far from anywhere we needed to be.

Reviews.Title: “Quick trip to Dallas”
Reviews.Author: MountainOrBeach
Reviews.Content: Had a very quick trip to Dallas and stayed at the Omni Park West. I have stayed at many Omni's but this was my first time here. I am a Select Guest so normally check in on-line and pick my keys up from their board. Upon arrival, checked board and no keys. We were not in a hurry so this was not a problem. We had ate a very large late lunch so decided to go to the lobby bar for a drink and small snack for dinner. The appetizer plates were huge and very good. Only problem which, once again, was not a problem since we were not in a rush was the slow service. It was a Friday night with a fair number of people at the bar and only one person working. She did her best but, really should have had someone helping her. The room was wonderful. Very large and comfortable. I loved the memory pillow and would love to know the brand so I could purchase one. This hotel is in a very convenient location and would recommend if you find yourself in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer P
Reviews.Content: We held our conference here and the staff was outstanding. They were very accommodating and friendly. I think we could have requested the moon and they would have made it happen. For the 9 hours a night I spent in my room, it was nice and comfortable. I slept great and enjoyed my Select Guest perks of having coffee delivered to my room each morning - especially since I had to be downstairs at 6:30 a.m. This is a very nice property and the five mile radius the hotel shuttle covers took us to some great restaurants. We had drinks and appetizers at the hotel restaurant which were very good. The gym was nice as well - only got to use it one morning, but it was nice to be able to do so.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Omni Park West”
Reviews.Author: adrianmix
Reviews.Content: Check in process was fast and efficient considering it was almost 11p and I was desperate for getting a room after a long day/flight from Los Angeles. Rooms are comfortable and very clean. I got a smoking room and all of the smoking rooms are on the 3rd floor so I got "I-635" view which was ok since the hotel is in the middle of a not very populated area. However, there are plenty of bars and restaurants a few minutes from the hotel on MacArhur Blvd / I - 635 crossing like iHop, Razzoo's (Cajun food), Whataburger, Applebee's, Chili's, Wendy's, Boston's grill, Saltgrass steakhouse, Mi Cocina and many more. Free parking and free internet were a big + ... please note you need to join the Omni's Loyalty program before getting to the hotel for getting free internet. Otherwise, you may pay a daily fee. Pool was great ...could only use it 2 days but always clean and not many guests around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, VERY well maintained hotel. My husband and I were there over the weekend and it was very quite. I guess they do most of their business during the week. We almost felt like we had the place to ourselves. We had a suite and paid less than you would expect to pay for a regular room. (Don't know if this is because weekends are slower.) Our suite was spacious and well maintained. In fact the entire property was clean and updated. Service was excellent! Although restaurants and shops are not within walking distance, there are dozens of restaurants a mile away. There is also a restaurant/bar in the hotel lobby. It has convenient access to I-35, and you can be downtown in about 15 minutes. We plan to use this hotel again for several upcoming trips to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travel!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaFamilyofFive
Reviews.Content: I attended a recent business meeting at this hotel. I paid about $175 for the room and feel I got a great value for my money. The hotel is impeccable and the food was excellent. The room was comfortable and the bed, cozy. The staff was efficient and courteous. The downsides: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere so you must drive or take a shuttle for any entertainment; the fitness center is embarrassingly small, cramped, and in disrepair; there is no refrigerator in the room except for the minibar -- which is locked.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavisEM
Reviews.Content: The Omni is clean, decor beautiful and food wonderful. The room as large and desk space for working, well, spacious! If you are a member of the Omni rewards club, the hotel will deliver tea, hot chocolate, coffee, etc of your choice in the morning gratis - a nice touch. The staff is very kind, polite and helpful - much needed after the rigors of travel. Located 30 seconds off the LBJ Freeway, close to DFW and not far from The Gallaria in North Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a smaller meeting, but in the middle of nowhere...”
Reviews.Author: loves2garden
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very friendly staff, the food and service are good, and rooms are fairly quiet. I was here for a conference and the hotel was very accommodating. However, the size of our conference (about 200 people) over-whelmed the elevator and bathroom capacity during the short (15 mins), brief breaks we had. Also, it was slightly annoying that housekeepers removed dirty washcloths and hand towels but didn't replace them unless asked specifically. The hotel was right next to a very nice jogging path through grass and trees along a lake, but on the other hand the hotel is in the middle of nowhere you would want to go. I would stay here again for a (smaller) conference but rent a car.

Reviews.Title: “Slept so well I avoided jet lag!”
Reviews.Author: Bagpuss3
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Clean, comfortable, quiet, great bed in the room and nice jacuzzi. Pretty good restaurant although a bit pricey. Would definitely return. Nice friendly staff too.

Reviews.Title: “Good place.”
Reviews.Author: TGS67
Reviews.Content: Near the airport, quiet room and very helpful staff. Breakfast is fantastic, one of the best I have tried. Good for business travel.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go wrong with Omni Dallas Park West!”
Reviews.Author: JimBobSpeaker
Reviews.Content: The Omni Hotels are customer service, quality and value all wrapped into one . The Omni Dallas Park West never disappoints me and I've been staying there for 10 years

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, need a car”
Reviews.Author: curlygirl91
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, but it's not within walking distance of anything or on public transportation. I stayed there for a conference and was pleased with the hotel. The public areas are beautiful and modern. The pool area was very nice, and there was a good fitness room. I never ate in the restaurants since my food was all included in my conference, but the food that they provided was plentiful and tasty. There was always lemonade and fruit at the front desk and they put out iced tea every afternoon. The staff were all about service and were all very friendly and helpful. The rooms were well equipped and the bed was comfortable. The bath products were good quality. One thing to know about staying here is to make sure to sign up for the Select Guest program. They deliver a newspaper and morning beverages and the wi-fi is free (it is $9.95 otherwise). The also have express check in and out. It's not close to anyplace to eat or to downtown. The hotel does have a shuttle to nearby restaurants, but there is nothing within walking distance. Keep that in mind if you will not have a car for your trip.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints At All”
Reviews.Author: buckley_girl98
Reviews.Content: Went here for a business meeting and was very pleased with my stay, as well as the meeting space. Everyone was very friendly. Loved the pool! Nice place to stay for business or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for smaller meetings”
Reviews.Author: KAQuinn
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times attending meetings of several hundred people. This hotel is easy to get to, but you do need a car if you want to get to other area attractions or restaurants. The newly-redecorated rooms are spotless. Service is excellent. If you join the Omni Select program (free to join), you can use the wi-fi for free. The hotel is very quiet, with the pool being on the end of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: photo413
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in this hotel with our two young boys, ages 11 & 7. I get the impression that this hotel is meant more for business travelers - I don't remember seeing any other families. The pool is very nice - spacious and plenty of seating. There is a hot tub but it is indoors in the spa / workout area. We stayed on the 5th floor and had very nice views. The only thing keeping me from giving this hotel 5 stars is that housekeeping left a bit to be desired. It was noticeable that they hadn't cleaned behind the bathroom door in some time - lots of fingerprints etc. Maybe that's just my own pickiness. Also on the last 24 hours of stay we were literally rationing toilet paper (not replenished by housekeeping) and did without wash cloths - they left us 1 for a room that accomodates 4 guests. I know that we could have asked for more - but in this type of hotel I expect those things to be handled without my having to ask.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: OmniGuest
Reviews.Content: Visited the Dallas area over the 4th of July weekend. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. I did not feel like just a "visitor" there. Doormen were absolutely professional! The Omni had events scheduled for their guests during the holiday weekend. The front desk clerk was very courteous and greeted me with a bright smile even though she looked quite busy. Rooms are clean and well worth the rate. Great location! I'd like to pass on my gratitude to the staff... To the Manager: keep up the good work

Reviews.Title: “Too remote from the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Ivan-and-Ellen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after flying in to Dallas. It was clean and quiet but characterless and miles from the city centre. I wouldn't rush back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: johnhuhlee
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business and it was great. Got a room for a very affordable price of $95.00 and it has the look and feel of a 5-star hotel. The only negative was the location. It's kind of in the suburbs so it's a little far from everything. I don't know the area very well, but I actually had a hard time finding a fast-food restaurant nearby. But other than that, everything else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here. Really. Stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Grotshops
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding hotel. These people really care about service and it shows. The rooms are very nice, but what sets this hotel apart is outstanding customer service. I was expected, welcomed, and cared for from before my arrival through my departure. I wish I could have stayed longer. I was at the hotel for a short conference, and the hotel did an outstanding job with room, catering and everything needed to make the conference work smoothly. I beat the conference room rate by 20% booking directly through the Omni website. The resulting room rate was comparable to what I would have paid at a much more ordinary hotel. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwueste
Reviews.Content: A lovely room, excellent service, the usual for the Omni. A bit out of the way, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Lewisville businesses”
Reviews.Author: socon1217
Reviews.Content: After being unable to secure rooms at my company's "preferred" hotels, we chose the Omni at ParkWest. No complaints here. The room was well-appointed and clean. The fact that Omni provides free internet access for their frequent-stay guests was definitely a plus. The hotel lobby was bright and airy, but always very crowded. Hotel staff was friendly and courteous. What was particularly nice was the proximity to the freeway/expressway. Being right off the highway meant quick access to both downtown Dallas and to our offices in Lewisville. 15 to 20 min. in either direction. Also not far from the airports.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best!”
Reviews.Author: Salsamaker
Reviews.Content: We came to Dallas for a nice long weekend get away and to do some shopping and get a feel for the big D. I looked at other luxury hotels on the net and almost went with another hotel in their family of hotels, until we read reviews. We decided to check this one out instead, sure glad we did. I asked for a room with a view when I booked online, I think we got the best scenery they could give us. Wonderful staff, great atmosphere, even helped us out when our car had trouble starting on a Sunday morning. We did not eat in the restaurant as we were always on the run, but had coffee and juice delivered to our door right when we asked it be brought to us. Only reason for lower marks in location is because it was further out than we expected, but worth the extra drive. And the hubby said the bed wasn't as comfortable as he thought it would be, but certainly better than most hotels I have stayed at. We will return in the summer and can't wait to come here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: Cazdog
Reviews.Content: Omni is a nice hotel. They have a workout room in the basement. There is a nice walking path across the street. The resturant is typical- overpriced as you see at many hotels. The thing that makes me downgrade them to a three star is the policy they have of charging you $9.95 per day for internet access. Why? Most other quality estabilshments I have stayed in will make this free. This is where they need to improve the most.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lucemis
Reviews.Content: I am a very picky on hotels, Omni at Park West delivered up to my expectations. We stayed on Valentine's weekend. The hotel was very nice, our room was clean, perfectly decorated with everything needed. Omni surprised us with a champagne, 2 flutes and strawberries covered with chocolate. This is a very nice touch after we mentioned that we were celebrating our 9th Valentine's together. Breakfast food was excellent, service at the restaurant and hotel was great. This is definitely a place we will go back for a romantic stay. Thank you Omni @Park west!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Business Hotel with Great Weekend Rates”
Reviews.Author: brngckn
Reviews.Content: This is a full service hotel. Beautiful lobby. Room was comfortable and nicely decorated. The only negative comment I can make is some of the bath grout needs to be replaced (mold stains, but that's common here in TX). The room had a mini-bar and nice desk setup. We stayed only one night and did not partake of the bar or restaurant, but they looked nice. Decent sized fitness room. Free parking but overpriced wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel- Excellent Value.”
Reviews.Author: Jpo2010
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and decoration was decent, the staff was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: evanston99
Reviews.Content: Nice lobby with pleasant staff, but few things that were annoying. I ordered room service and after 1 hour I called to find out the chef "was confused" and forgot my order...now it would take 20-30 more minutes. Had I not called, it would have not been acknowledged. They should have called about the problem. Instead of apology, I was told it was busy (excuses instead of owning up) but I was given a free beer. Another thing was I heard the doorman and shuttle driver referring to "them Koreans" which I later learned was the staff of Korean airlines who stay there. While not horrible, they were making comments that could be interpreted as derogatory had they heard. Overall ok, but not great

Reviews.Title: “I would LIVE at this hotel if I could---”
Reviews.Author: dallasokie71
Reviews.Content: The check-in was a no-brainer and the price was beyond excellent. I had requested a corner room with 2 queen beds and got just what I asked for---along with a huge bathroom, windows on two walls, nice easy chair, working desk, and great TV. A locked mini-bar was in the armoire. The pool was heated to 82 degrees (we asked) and was gorgeous with many loungers with towels available. The hot tub was located between the ladies' and men's locker rooms, each of which had a sauna. We chose to indulge in an adults-only breakfast at the hotel and had an incredible meal for not much more than we would have spent at IHOP (where we took the teenagers after they woke up). The hotel is one mile west of the intersection of I-35 and I-635 (LBJ Freeway) and about 8 miles east of DFW Airport, which puts it about 15 minutes north of downtown Dallas and about 10 minutes west of the Galleria area. We make occasional trips to Dallas and have decided to return to the Omni whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALENTINES DAY EVER”
Reviews.Author: msnikkibme
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutley gorgeous and yet the prices won't break your pocket book/ wallet. We had the sweet rendevouz package and the room was gorgeous! They took care in decorating the room and when I asked for chocholate covered strawberries instead of the trouffle it was no problem at all! Also the music channel with the beautiful backgrounds on the tv was a nice touch.The valet staff were excellent and very friendly, as were the rest of the staff. This will be the only place me and my boyfriend will stay when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Ro409
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels and on this trip we decided to try out two fairly new ones. First we stayed at the Omni and we had a wonderful experience (Also ar Aloft in Downtown Dallas). Very cozy and comfortable. Beware though, you may not want to leave the room since they are great! We stayed on the 10th floor and added the romantic package. The breakfast was the best i have ever had at any hotel and the front desk was very nice! I can not say anything bad about this hotel or else i would. Will surely visit many other Omni hotels and resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Omni Park West”
Reviews.Author: TexasJ30
Reviews.Content: This was my 5th stay at this hotel. I was in town with my wife on business and to attend a wedding. The service at this hotel is great. Its a big, quiet, clean hotel away from the city, but not too far away from everything. They have all the ammenities and the staff is very eager to help. I will stay here again soon. I would recommend this hotel to the business traveler or married people traveling without children.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - excellent value!!”
Reviews.Author: LaTechFanatic
Reviews.Content: We loved every part of our stay. The hotel staff was very efficient and curteous upon arrival. We found a nice cold bottle of water, our ice bucket filled, and candied pecans waiting for us in our room. Nice touch. We did experience some rowdy fellow guests, but the staff took care of them very quickly and we were able to rest well. We stayed on a Saturday night and found the breakfast to take a bit long at the restuarant on Sunday morning, but they were very apologetic about it. We understand things happen. We loved our stay here and can't wait to make our way back again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are missing key elements”
Reviews.Author: MaloneV
Reviews.Content: Okay, so maybe I got the wrong room. I was put into a room with a giant conference table with 12 chairs without any warning from the front desk. Very odd. Then, no room service menu, no ironing board (yet there was an iron), no coffee pot, and a view of the HVAC system on the roof. Maybe the house cleaners just didn't do a great job on my room?

Reviews.Title: “Treated like royalty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. I called in advance to let them know of my down feather allergy and requested down alternative. They asked me the reason for my stay and I told them. When we arrived we were upgraded to a junior suite. Much to my surprise we had chocolate covered strawberries and champagne. Our stay was fabulous! I feel let down at any other hotel because we were treated so well. We are select guest members and frequent Omni's often, but Omni Park West is by far our favorite! :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect venue for reception”
Reviews.Author: k&k007
Reviews.Content: My son was married in the Dallas area on New Years Eve. We had the Rehearsal Dinner at the Omni and I couldn't have been more pleased. Diana Sandoval was awesome to work with. We had a Mexican Buffet and it was one of the best meals I've ever eaten...EVER. That along with the elegant presentation makes this an easy place to recommend for any type of reception or meeting. We had lots of family and friends from both sides of the bridal party staying here. Every one of them had only positive things to say about their rooms and the service they received. I spoke to Mike Woodfin when we set up the rooms. He is also great to work with and helpful with whatever questions I had. This should be the #1 hotel in Dallas because that was our experience...and I'm picky.

Reviews.Title: “best customer service”
Reviews.Author: kamloopsbarbiegirl
Reviews.Content: My first time posting review on trip advisor. I feel i must compliment this hotel because all the staff was phenominal. I checked in late at night and the guy working at the front desk was very welcoming and informative. The ladies who were working the front desk in the morning were great as well. Housekeeping was excellent. The rooms were quite spacious and clean. Next time I visit Dallas I will be staying here for sure. Great first impression folks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: txtravelagenttx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a quick getaway. Hotel is beautiful and spotless! Love the free covered parking. Location is not great but not bad. Staff goes above and beyond to make you feel special. They didnt have what we wanted in the mini bar and the gift shop was closed but they offered to open it up for us so that we could get what we wanted. Beds were very comfortable. We could hear the people beside and above us some but that def. was not a deal breaker. Without a doubt- I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it--great with kids”
Reviews.Author: thankyoupaige
Reviews.Content: Hi. The Omni was great! We went over Easter weekend. They left each kid a goody bag and gave them yummy cookies and milk each night that we were there. They were very responsive. The rooms were very clean and comfortable! One down side---need some cheaper/kid friendly food!

Reviews.Title: “Not One Problem”
Reviews.Author: mtngirljen
Reviews.Content: My number one requirement is cleanliness and this entire hotel was spotless. Top marks also go to the huge rooms with queen beds, amazing staff and larger fitness center with well appointed and maintained equipment. I stayed at this hotel for a wedding and received a room rate that is practically unheard of. And the reception was AMAZING! Nice work. My only issue was the requirement of a rental car but I think thatâ€™s a Dallas thing â€“ itâ€™s a land of highways and strip malls so donâ€™t expect public transportation or the ability to walk places :(

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: kdbcrb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from the Omni in Dallas after traveling to Texas for the Red River Rivalry. Although I frequently use Tripadvisor for research, I rarely post reviews. However, we were so impressed with the Omni I felt I should leave a note. The only two cons I can list are the size of the rooms (we had a room with a King) and the $9.95 charge to access the wi-fi. Although the room was small, it was still nice, tasteful and clean. We opted to use our phones for any internet service we needed, but it seems like free wi-fi is the standard these days, and we were disappointed to find otherwise. We tried to use the hotel's business room to attemt to pull up directions, but found that required the charge as well. Out side of those two minor issues, the Omni was an EXCELLENT value - with a price half of what we would have paid downtown - the service was twice as friendly and the accomodations were just as nice. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible staff is the icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: LuvztoTravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a month for work and it was such a wonderful experience. The staff is simply the best part of this hotel. The ladies and gentlemen of Omni Dallas treated me like family. Enrique and Tobie at the front desk were superb and the team of ladies and gentlemen in the breakfast room were simply awesome. They would welcome me to breakfast and make me an awesome custom omelette and bring it to the table with fresh coffee and fruit. if I didn't have time to stay for a meal, they would prepare a to go box for me with coffee- they would even go so far as to toast my bagel for me! Long story short, this is a great hotel that takes the time to learn your name and make sure that you are comfortable. One night there was a group that was making alot of noise. When I complained to the hotel, I came home the next night to an apology letter, a glass of wine, and a special treat. Such a nice change from most places! If you join the Omni club, which is free, you get free internet and you can get free hot coffee brought to your room in the mornings. Right by the 635 and very close to Dallas airports.

Reviews.Title: “My new Dallas Favorite”
Reviews.Author: TXnatives
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay during the 4th of July Holiday. The service was great. Room was wonderful, we had plenty of room with peace and quiet. There was a wedding so I was thinking things might be bad for parking and those staying the night at the hotel but I didn't even notice them other than in the ball room. The covered parking was great because even with the size of the hotel you don't have to park a mile away. The location was central for shopping and with the access to the interstate it made it easy to go around the city. I will definitely stay here again in the fall when we head out for another game. The only thing I do not recommend is for anyone to go through the trail near the hotel because it is not maintained. The landscaping around that running path is not maintained so it was a miserable experience. I tried the exercise room and though it is small it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Astrosfan01
Reviews.Content: I am usually a fan of Omni hotels, but this one fell below my expectations. I reserved two rooms for two nights, one for me and my husband and one for his parents. The 2 queen beds room I requested for me and my husband was a nice size. However, the room with a king-size bed I had requested for my in-laws was half the size and had a horrible odor. I called the front desk, and they gave my in-laws another room that had 2 double beds, but more room. The tub in my room had rust all over the drain. I called housekeeping to remove the rust, and the maintence person reluctantly did so after I agreed not to take a shower until the morning so the paint could dry. No offer of another room was made. The free morning beverages is a nice perk of Omni hotels, but I did not get the soymilk I had requested for my coffee or the croissant I had ordered. Turns out they ran out of croissants, but couldn't be bothered to let me know by writing a note or calling to see if I wanted an alternative item. The following night we returned to the hotel @ 9 pm to take showers and rest. After I got out of the shower, I smelled smoke. My in-laws called our room and reported the same thing. The front desk informed us that an A/C unit caught fire and offered to allow us to change rooms, which we accepted. It would have been nice if they made the offer on their own rather than us having to ask. We moved 2 floors down, and my in-laws were disappointed that their replacement room was the same size as the small room they had initially received. The hotel did give us free breakfast coupons, which made the late night move a little more bearable, and allowed us to end our stay on a positive note. It was nice that I got to listen to my in-laws rave about the restaurant staff and food rather than how bad the accommodations were.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel, comfortable, quiet, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Rkymtn84
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two children spent a weekend at this wonderful hotel. From the minute we walked in we were greeted by several staff to assist us checking in. Our children each received a welcome "backpack' which they loved. Our room was spacious, very clean and most comfortable. The bathroom was also a surprise as it was bigger that most bathrooms in a hotel. I never heard a peep from any other guests, very quiet hotel. The location is close to DFW Airport but jet noise was never heard except for an occasional jet flying over, you wouldn't think twice about it. The onsite restaurant was wonderful and reasonably priced. You can always expect hotel restaurants to charge a bit more. This restaurant will not break your budget. I highly recommend booking your room with the breakfast included as this will save you money. I have never written a review for a hotel before but I felt I should for this one. My family will most definitely come back as our experience here was wonderful. There is more than ample parking as there is a parking garage next to the hotel. (No charge) One note of caution, if you use GPS or Google Maps to find this hotel. It will lead you in the wrong direction. We found this out ourselves. After calling the front desk while on the interstate, the told us the correct route to the hotel. They are aware of this problem also and are trying to correct it. The hotel itself in on I-635W and Luna Rd. This is west of I-35E. You will see the hotel from I-635W We most definitely will be returning to the Omni Dallas Hotel at Park West.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: jaydawn
Reviews.Content: We spent our wedding night at the beautiful Omni Park West- Dallas in July 1999--- and we keep coming back. We just spent the night this weekend to celebrate our 11th anniversary. Still just as lovely and relaxing. This hotel has it all--- nice room size, comfy linens, robes, great toilteries, wonderful buffet breakfast, on and on. Also a nice outdoor pool and BONUS----- FREE parking! They even sent up surprise champagne and strawberries for anniversary. The only warning is that it is in the middle of vacant stretch on 635 no resturants/shopping in walking distance, but still close to drive to anything you may want or need. We have stayed here 5 times over the last decade- and still love it!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Omni Park West while...”
Reviews.Author: Lindsmac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Park West while driving through Dallas to San Antonio. We arrived around 11:30. pm and the service was wonderful! The King room was very nice. Modern decor and very clean. There was a holiday special so the price was less than expected. A bargain! My only wish was that we could have stayed longer. I will definitely stay here next time I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: HobieJuan10
Reviews.Content: I do not make a habit of reviewing hotels but I enjoyed my stay at the Omni so much that I feel obligated to take a moment to give them a hearty endorsement. Each and every member of their staff was sincerely friendly and accommodating throughout my four day stay. My room was spacious, quiet and clean and I found the location to be great for my needs. Downtown Dallas is a short hop as is Grapevine Mills Mall. There are also a wide variety of restaurants just a few minutes away on 635 and along MacArthur in Irving. After extensive travel in Texas over the last month the Omni Park West gets my highest marks. This will be my hotel of choice the next time business takes me to Dallas. (Let me also suggest that you register as a "Select Guest" prior to your stay. I did this on a whim and found the free internet, morning paper and monrning beverage service made my stay all the more enjoyable.)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable...Clean...”
Reviews.Author: bigolepig
Reviews.Content: Very nice, quiet hotel. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was nice size, and nicely decorated, and most importantly...CLEAN!! If you are not afraid to get out and brave the traffic to get to the "hot spots" in the Metroplex, this hotel is centrally located to every place you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: OKC_Husker
Reviews.Content: We brought 2 friends with us to show off the Omni and we all had a great time! The staff goes out of their way to make the stay comfortable. Our rooms were great for a restful night of sleep and the complimentary morning beverages were great to wake up to. (w/ Select Guest). One of our favorite things about the hotel is the Health Club in the basement. You dont have to walk through the hotel in your swimsuit to get to the hot tub or pool. You take the elevator straight down to the spa level. The pool was very relaxing. (There are trees that block the view of the highway and there are cascading jets of water that drown the sound of any traffic) We also love the morning work-outs in the weight room. Location worked great for us too. It is north of Dallas which is not too far of a drive from the Ballpark or Cowboy stadium. The wives' liked being close to the galleria and the kids like going to Dave & Busters which was not far either!

Reviews.Title: “OK for a basic hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: coach_boom
Reviews.Content: ..only "basic" amenities for what appears to be a much nicer hotel. Food selections are mediocre at best, very little surrounds the property, nice televisions capable of high-definition TV but terrible cable service that does not even offer most of the local channels, still charge for local calls, appears to offer "complementary high speed internet" but unless you read the fine print and sign up for their frequent rewards plan you are charged $10/day for the service, and they had the dates wrong on my reservation despite me having my printed itinerary from the date I made the reservation a month in advance. They fixed it, but if the property had been full I have no doubt that I would have been out on the street. I travel a lot - free internet, excellent quality TV, hassle-free reservations you can see online - these are all offered by the true "luxury" chains, why cant these be available though the "Omni"?

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel With Great Rates & 5-Diamond Level Service!”
Reviews.Author: bmw745ion19s
Reviews.Content: FIrst of all Id like to start off with something I noticed other reviews: I dont understand how people can give a hotel bad ratings overall just because they dont like the location. Sure you cant walk to places to eat or shop from the hotel but you knew this when you mad a reservation here, its not the hotels fault you cant use a map! Ok, with that being said I booked this hotel for a last minute stay int he area, I normally like to stay more towards the center of Dallas but with a rate of $92 all in I figured I couldnt go wrong. An additional incentive to me was their comp. self parking in a garage, I dont mind paying to park but I dont trust most valets with some of my diff. cars. When I arrived at the hotel I noticed while about 15 minutes to downtown it was right off the expressway so it was no problem to get anywhere in the city in a decent amount of time. The bell staff were quick to collect my bags and take me to my room. The rooms werent very large but were decorated very nicely as the rest of the hotel was and were more then adequate for 1 or 2 people. I did not notice any elevator noise as some complained of. The only downside I noticed on the hard product the outside of the hotel could use a good pressure cleaning or fresh paint. Service was where the Omni really impressed me. Ive stayed at lots of 5-Diamond hotels that would have trouble keeping up with the Omni's service standard. I was always greeted very quickly and by name. Everything was done quickly when I requested it and I never once heard a no. I had one unusual request that they had no need to fulfill but they did it for me anyways, I was very impressed! I normally do not eat at the hotels as I like to go to local, well known establishments when Im in different cities. However, one night I was extremely tired and not very hungry. I ordered a childrens cheese burger with french fries (probably the same size as the adult burger!), ice cream for dessert and a bottle of Pellegrino water, for around $12. The quality was very good as well. I would not hesitate to stay here again, very good job to everyone at the Omni!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business travel”
Reviews.Author: mgralnc
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable room, helpful, friendly service. Good range of dining options. Convenient to airport. Adequate fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - not far from eveything”
Reviews.Author: Tricky666
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Omni in Dallas earlier this month! Everything was enjoyable and comfortable. We didn't try the in-house restaurants as we were visiting family who lived nearby but they looked very nice. The room was a great size and were on the 11th floor far from the lifts (my tip is to join the guest select scheme before you go and make sure they know you are a member as they will give you a well located room and a few other benefits (it's free!). The staff were very friendly and I had a few good chats about sports etc at the bar or with the doormen. Location is awesome - we were 15 mins from the airport and only half and hour from downtown Dallas. I think the hotel is mainly for businees users i.e. 1 or 2 nights at a time but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!”
Reviews.Author: OKCmeNwater
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Omni. LOVE IT! The staff is the sweetest EVER! The rooms are average...1 suggestion: if you're ok w/ a room w/ 2 queen beds, get a corner room (the bathrooms are twice the size of a suite bathroom). We went to the co-ed, indoor hot tub both times I've stayed and it was always empty and very nice (romantic even)! It's nice that it's a business hotel, not many people are there on the weekends. The staff at Dover's and the bar (which both are beautiful) are super nice and become your best friends by the end of your trip! Dinner and breakfast was delicious! Doormen were extremely sweet and courteous every time. Great gym w/ individual locker rooms and sauna. I haven't been in the heated outdoor pool but there were some people in it when I stayed in October. Looked warm enough, and very pretty. Well maintained. Go to the top floor, there's a really neat lounge there w/ TV's and views for DAYS! And no one ever mentioned it to us (or told us NOT to be there ; ). The only problem I found with this hotel is the small bathrooms in the suites and rooms that aren't on the corners. For some reason they are the size of a closet. But other than that..I would recommend this hotel to anyone...be it for a romantice get away, a big or small wedding or a business trip. Very quiet and affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: DandGHeidelberg
Reviews.Content: This hotel stay was for a romantic night away for my wife and i. The staff was very helpful and very friendly. They treated us very well. The room was cozy but the bed was soooo comfortable! We stayed on the fourth floor and were only a couple of doors down from the elevators and never heard a sound. now i would say that if you are in room 401 you will probably want to change rooms because that room backs right up to the elevator maintanence room and elevators so i would guess that might be annoying. other then that it very nice and got a great rate. not to far from everything in dallas, you just have to be prepared to have a car and deal with traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 25stjames
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at numerous hotels in Dallas over the past ten years on regular business trips. This hotel is easily the best hotel that I have stayed at over the time interval. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “What is the deal with the noise?”
Reviews.Author: Misha22
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for 4 nights on business. A prior reviewer hit the nail on the head about noise coming from the elevators. My room was probably 6 or 7 doors down from the elevator and you could hear loud humming as the elevator went up and down ALL DAY LONG! Granted, it was less frequent late at night but an annoyance nonetheless. One expects peace and quiet and a good night's sleep from an Omni hotel. This problem alone would cause me never to stay here again and never to recommend this hotel to anyone else. I am giving this hotel 3 stars because everything else about my stay was pretty good. The room was clean and spacious and nicely appointed. Service was professional and friendly. Price wasn't bad at $100/night. The location is tolerable but you must be willing to do everything at the hotel or have a car at your disposal to get to any restaurants or shopping. It really is in the middle of nowhere. But, it is convenient to the airport and there are restaurants and strip mall stores only 1 or 2 exits down the road. It's quite a drive to downtown and Dallas traffic can be fairly miserable. If on business and needing to stay in the area, I had a much more pleasant stay at the Doubletree in Farmers Branch just down the road and would recommend that to others.

Reviews.Title: “True sence of the phrase "Biz-traveler Hotel"....”
Reviews.Author: STLfan420
Reviews.Content: I stayed here once for work. Check in was nice and easy. The rooms are set up perfectly for business travelers, and the rooms are little larger than regular hotel rooms. The outlets to plug stuff in are embedded into the work desk, so you don't have to get on all fours to find a plug..which was real nice. The food in the restaurant is better than OK. The bottled beers are $5.50 each. They even have a "New Wine Bar" which is in the hallway to the restaurant. They specialize in new wines from all over the world. They have new wines come in all the time. They decorate really nicely for Christmas, and the hotel is right off the highway so easy access to many locations in the Dallas area. I would recommend for general and biz-travelers.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury concrete prison on the highway - there must be better places”
Reviews.Author: berejstDK
Reviews.Content: LetÂ´s look at the positive side of this place: The food - and service around the food - is consistently great, the rooms are seriously spacious and the staff is really friendly. But I would never recommend this place to anyone, really. This city hotel is in the middle of nowhere, in a bad sense. ItÂ´s placed right at the highway, and the closest location to anything interesting (airport, city, mall) is 8-10 miles and up, with a heavy traffic to deal with. There is absolutely nothing around it besides a slightly tacky new housing area, and the hotel has limited itÂ´s services to get out to a depressing little pool area, just in front of the highway area or a parking lot. Nice for a city hotel... The service is working, until you start asking questions. With one obvious exception - a young receptionist - I have never in my life heard that many "I donÂ´t know", and gotten so little information about the hotel, the possibilities around, the city - anything. A tourist information? "I donÂ´t know". Where is my conference? "The what? - I canÂ´t find it in the folder". And yes, the room was huge. But the location at the highway with badly isolating windows gave such a traffic noise that it simply woke me up every morning - too early. If I havenÂ´t already been waken up by the intense noise when a neighbour entered the room, and the door slammed. Kapow! At least the beds were great, so one could enjoy the sleep until the noise got to you. And last, I simply felt like a cash cow in the room. Where other hotels would have information signs or free offers, especially at this price level, here you we got "Buy this", Want to use this, itÂ´s only 6 USD", "Want to see a movie, 19.99 USD" (for ONE regular theather movie). For several days I was wondering if I got a huge bill for using the coffee machine, because there was no sign, but either they forgot or it was simply free. And 7 USD for using a computer at a service center for 15 minutes! Pure cashcowing. It surely was great texan food and local specialities, but it was also a noisy restaurant, because of the ventilation systems from the open kitchen right next to it. And quite expensive for the local price standard, again. So yes, it felt like a luxury prison - a nice one, but hey, who wants to pay to go to prison? And if I were a conference planner I wouldnÂ´t feel safe with all the "I donÂ´t know"Â´s out there. There must be better options in this huge area, especially if you go on a private trip.

Reviews.Title: “High price for not so high quality”
Reviews.Author: vranda22
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the rooms were spacious; however, I expect more than that from the places I stay. I was 11 rooms away from the elevators and could hear them all night long, which made it difficult to sleep. The first night I ordered room service which was not good at all. I ate in the restaurant, everyday for lunch, for this was a business trip. The first day there was food stuck on the plate. The second day there was a lipstick mark on my coffee cup and the silverwear had food stuck on them. The third day, food stuck on the dishware again. "Gross." The employees had no idea what was located in the general area as far as restaurants or other attractions. I suppose you were to stay and never want to leave their facility? Overall I was completely dissatisfied with the overall experience at this location. I expected more since they were ranked 4 stars...and for the price...maybe worth a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, big rooms, fun pool, good value.”
Reviews.Author: jrdAustin_TX
Reviews.Content: We spent the weekend here while we toured Dallas with our young children. It was a nice location, kind of far away from town, but not too far. The hotel is very nice, the room was huge with 2 queen beds and a large bathroom. We enjoyed the pool a lot.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: hookmhornsAustin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our first year anniversary and stayed at this hotel. We spent three nights in the king deluxe room, it was very spacious and modern. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the hotel is located near beltline, which has some shopping and lots of restaurants. We were also very close to the Dallas Gallaria that has all the high end stores we liked. The Dallas Aquarium is a must see, it is awesome! I do have to mention that the beds are a little firm, but overall our stay was great.

Reviews.Title: “Most successful conference I've ever booked!”
Reviews.Author: walterBChicago_Il
Reviews.Content: I book two to three dozen conferences a year around the country and the staff at the Omni West were the very best to deliver exactly what I asked for but more. Their attention to detail and professionalism exceeded my expectations. I will look for other Omnis in other cities due to the fact that the Omni West was so perfect! My conferences are attended by personel and future clients, therefore it is very important to get the details right. I was especially impressed by a young lady named Audrey, who made sure everything went as planned. (Would love to hire her away from the Omni but she is a very loyal employee of the company)

Reviews.Title: “Best premium hotel value in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Norman_Sooner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Dallas 5-7 times a year to get away and maybe do a little shopping and dine at a new restaurant (or an old favorite). This property is becoming one of our favorite places to stay. Approaching from the freeway, the surrounding area is definitely unimpressive but the hotel sticks out like a sore thumb (which makes it easy to find). The last time we were there there was some construction next door, which was somewhat of an eyesore. But once inside, you'll know 'this is the place'. The staff is unfailingly friendly and helpful. You can self-park if you like (parking is free and covered in an attached parking garage) or you can avail yourself of valet service and a bellhop if all you want to do is relax. Check-in is quick and easy, and you can even pre-check-in via the internet if you are a member of their (free) affinity club. They have a comfy and intimate bar area and a nice restaurant, but the room is the most important thing and you won't be disappointed. The bed and appointments are quite nice and you won't lack for anything (especially if you remember to ask for a key to the mini-bar). They have room service (of course) if you just want to stay in your room, or head up the highway to find a restaurant - there are dozens just up the road at the MacArthur exit, as well as a mulitplex theater and tons of shops. A little farther up the road is the Grapevine mall (an indoors outlet mall) and quite a few more restaurants and shops surrounding it, including a Bass Pro Shop (worth the trip just to see their huge aquariums stocked with native sport fish). Or head the other direction on I-635 and you can be to the Galleria area in 15 minutes. Downtown and the West End/Deep Ellum is a 20-25 minute trip south on I-35. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Dallas for leisure and wanting to stay in the North Dallas area. The prices are quite reasonable and they have specials all the time, especially for weekend stays. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: jdschu66
Reviews.Content: Main complaints were lack of a vent in the bathroom and our room was a bit on the small side. A/C was cold enough, but left the air a bid humid. If you have a car, good restaurants are about 10 to15 minutes away. Staff was very friendly. Would stay again given the good price we received.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: txninja
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel at all. We got a good rate through American Express and really enjoyed our stay. The aesthetics of the exterior and interior are top notch. The location was nice, the rooms were great, and the amenities were good. Hotel staff seemed genuinely willing to please. The pool was nice and wasn't very crowded while we were there. The room was better than expected for the price. We plan on staying there again during our next visit to the Metroplex.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay...Close to mostly everything!”
Reviews.Author: ant_jenna
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Park West in Dallas from June 19-21. We make infrequent visits to Dallas to visit my husbands family. The Omni is a really nice hotel! We had standard king room on the 9th floor. The bed was comfortable... especially after traveling 4 hours from San Antonio. The room had a 32" flat screen HD TV. Also, I highly recommend joining their loyalty program. It allows you to have free internet access. Otherwise, it is 9.95 per day. Also, when you are a member, you get complimentary morning beverages. In previous posts, some people mentioned a low constant humming. I noticed it, but did not let it bother me. Trivial things like that do not bother me when the overall atmosphere is pleasant. Also, they do have a stocked minibar. The pricing on the items are expensive. The Omni also hasa gift shop. The items there are slightly less expensive than the minibar but not by much. They do allow pets for $50 nonrefundable deposit for the entire stay. They do have a fitness center which was fully equipped with ellipitcals, treadmills, stationary bikes, and weights. Also, they have a dry sauna in both the mens and womens area and a shared hot tub. We ate twice from the restaurant. It is quite expensive, but overall, the food was good and the service was good. The hotel is located off of 635 and between the GeorgeBush tollway and 35. You can take 635 either direction to get to restaurants, convenience stores, and a movie theater, easily within 5 minutes. Also, within 10 minutes going East on 635, you can get to the Galleria. Overall, we loved the stay. It had all the amenities that we desired plus much more. It exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing could have been better!”
Reviews.Author: 5genoklahoman
Reviews.Content: It's always that last 5-10% of anything that is the hardest to achieve. The Omni Park West achieves - and then surpasses! I simply cannot say how much we loved our 2 nights here. As long as it isn't rush hour, everything from downtown Dalls to Six Flags is only 10-20 minutes away. The hotel specializes in hosting in-hotel conferences in their gorgeous facilities, but this vactioning family was warmly welcomed and eagerly served. The staff isn't just friendly or polite, it's like we have come to their own home to stay. And not just the front desk, but the bus boys and housekeeping and gardeners! These are the happiest bunch of employees I've ever seen, proud of their hotel and eager to prove their considerable worth. We stayed in an Executive Suite which was very large and very comfortable with a nice view (although it's true there isn't much too look at around the hotel itself). About 5 minutes away is MacArthur Blvd which has any kind of food or retail anyone would need. Yes, you can hear the soft purr of the elevators, even in the bathroom, but it didn't bother us at all. We live downtown and are used to trains and sirens and such at night. But if you are used to dead quiet in the night, the elevators would probably bother you. The biggest surprise of all was the food. The chef at the Park West is stellar and we had some of the best food we've ever eaten in Dallas. The hand cut fries, gourmet macaroni and cheese, and the tortilla soup were especially unique and expertly prepared. Best of all, room service is reasonably priced - no 300% markups! - with fast and generous service. For health-concious travellers, this is absolutely the place. The health club is huge with every kind of equipment, the heated pool doubles as a fountain outside the restaurant, and there is a spa/whirlpool in the basement that is secluded and relaxing. The breakfast buffet is filled with Kashi cereals and 20 kinds of fresh-cut fruit, steel cut oatmeal and other tasty and healthy food. I can't list all the little things that made a big impact - covered parking out of the Texas sun, full-sized soaps, thoughtful notes, HDTV!, etc. From now on, we will always stay at an Omni Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: sprinkles17
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas with my mother for a girls' weekend getaway. Getting there was easy and self parking is free in the hotel garage. The hotel is a little far out, which makes for a boring view but a quiet sleep. We had breakfast in the hotel's restaurant, Dover's, and our waitress, Rosanna, was so sweet and funny that we went again the next morning. The breakfast tacos bring me back there every time I go to Dallas! Dinner at the restaurant was also nice, although pricey. Overall, a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “The Omni was nice”
Reviews.Author: SofaKing
Reviews.Content: This is an elegantly decorated hotel with a nice resturant and bar. The location is nice since it's right off the freeway and about 15 minutes from downtown Dallas but there isn't a lot around the property itself as far as resturants or shopping from what we could tell. It was too cool outside to check out the pool area but it looked nice as well. The staff was nice as well. The fitness center was quite nice which included a sauna and hottub.I do have a few complaints though. We stayed in room 706 and there was this intermittent humming noise that went on 24 hours a day of our two day stay. It may have been from the elevator but we were about 5 rooms down from that so I'm not so sure. It was annoying at times. Especially when it was dead quiet and you're trying to fall asleep. The beds were nicely decorated and pretty comfortable with the exception of the pillows. They were just like sticking your head into a heap of clothes. No support at all and I was using two of them. We got a room service breakfast which was tasty but was way WAY over priced. On the menu it looks like you are going to pay around $25.00-$30.00 for the full breakfast for two but when the final bill came it topped out about $50.00 with additional fees! It was $90 per night to stay there! That's a little messed up for a breakfast. There seemed to be ample free parking at all times so that was good. Check in and check out were pretty standard. To conclude, it was worth the price we payed through hotels.com but if we had payed the standard price, it probably would have been too much. I would recommend it but avoid room 706 and maybe that floor alltogether.

Reviews.Title: “It did what it said on the tin...and not much else. Clean but soul-less”
Reviews.Author: philipellis
Reviews.Content: The steward on the incoming flight was baffled: why are you coming to Dallas? we had 3 reasons: Southfork / JR & the Ewing clan ; Deeley Plaza & JFK, and the Galleria shopping mall. Our one night visit to Dallas ( from our three week holiday home in florida) had been uber organized in advance, and we selected as our base the Omni hotel after reading reviews on trip adviser. The hotel was clean and functional and well located just off the interstate, but it never really clicked for us; the fact that we'd been given rooms on the 2nd floor with a lovely view of a flat roof leading to the interstate didn't exactly endear the hotel to us; we were only there for 1 night so we didn't bother asking for better rooms and we only used the hotel as a base but maybe it was too functional. The rooms themselves were, though clean, a little dark and gloomy. There were a number of large business conferences and tour groups staying at the hotel at the same time as us, so maybe this hotel is more suited to that type of traveler than my wayward family. Nevertheless, the pool was nice (though too hot to endure in the August Texas sun shine) and the concierge did well in suggesting a restaurant we all enjoyed. There is a large free car park attached to the hotel; a car is essential as there is little around the hotel (however, this is common in America ). Dallas itself for 2 days was fab: we found out who shot JR, but not who shot JFK (the picket fence really is only 50 yards from the X on the highway where he was first shot); The Galleria Mall was superb for a Brit (with a wife & 2 teenage daughters) in the heady days when you could get $2 to the Â£, and was really worth the extra $$ for valet parking. A hire car with a sat nav is essential; Texas is massive (certainly by English standards) and the off site car hire at DFW airport was a breeze. There were plenty of frequent buses to and from the 2 locations. So it's a big thumbs up for Dallas, and a fairly neutral wave goodbye to the Omni; it did what it said on the tin, but that's all it did. Incidentally, on our return flight to MCO, we were staggered to find 2 identical separate car parks with 2 identical floors and very little to identify & differentiate them in the way of signage. At midnight, we left the airport to return to floor 5, row 7, space 6 in the car park to find an empty space. An hour later, and after much tears and tantrums (from me, let alone the girls) we discovered (with the help of the single security guard on duty after midnight) an identical car park next door, where our vehicle resided in floor 5, row 7, space 6.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel -- not in the city”
Reviews.Author: surreyuk
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Enjoyed the complementary morning drinks delivered to the room. Good facilities. Very close to the airport. Not close to downtown at all.

Reviews.Title: “Shiny... on the outside, that is.”
Reviews.Author: lindseyebuchanan
Reviews.Content: My husband canceled a room at The Lumen after reading how wonderful the Omni was. We thought we'd try somewhere new, instead of staying where we ALWAYS stay. Big mistake. What we thought would be a wonderful birthday trip for me was nothing close to wonderful. It was just plain bad. The location is okay, being that it is right off the highway and easy to find, but we didn't care for it overall. It is supposed to sit on a lake, but where is the lake? I didn't see one. My husband joked that their promo picture must be of an Omni in Chicago or LA, because it looks nothing like the pictures in person. The room was standard in size, nothing special here, but the bathroom was terrible. The sink sits out very far, making it difficult to apply make up. I had to use a magnifying mirror to come close, and I hate those! For a woman, this is something that is important when you have a husband waiting two hours for you to get ready. It took me forever! I had to lean in all sorts of ways to be able to see myself in the mirror. I gave up and used the little one, because it reached where I was standing. The water is VERY hard. When I say VERY, I am not exaggerating. My hair broke off when dry. I am so glad I packed a few cute hats for a night out on the town! =) As for service, what service? They took all of our soap when they cleaned the rooms, and it took an hour and three calls to the front desk to get any. I forgot my body wash... silly me! One would think they would supply soap, when politely asked for it. As for the beds, they are very hard. The "foam" pillows are not foam, and the down pillows are old and worn. We had to get six just to sleep, and even then, it took forever to get comfortable. I woke up many times to readjust my pillows. When calling for extras, we requested four and received one. After a day of just dealing with it, I called again for more down pillows, and received nothing. A trip to the front desk proved fruitful. We received our pillows, although just as bad as the first set, it was nice to be listened to. Casey was wonderful! I informed him that it was my birthday, and that our stay had been less than pleasant, and he personally delivered the pillows, along with champagne and strawberries. It was a nice gesture, but we would have enjoyed a discount or some other form of compensation. A cheap bottle of Brut was a little beneath our standards, and we are no snobs! The strawberries were good, though. The hot tub rocked, so a plus there. The gym is state-of-the-art. I didn't use it, because we wanted to take a break from our normal routine at home, but I was very impressed with the equipment. It made me wished I'd packed by running shoes! Would we stay here again? Never. We will gladly pay more to stay at the Lumen, which is where we've stayed before. The Lumen is only rated 3-star, but puts the 4-star Omni in the dust with service, comfy beds, awesome showers, and a convenient location. You just can't beat them. You may think the Omni is classy and shiny, as I did upon arrival, but when you take a closer look, you will find that the marble pillars are not marble at all, but covered in "marble" wallpaper instead. Nice try, Omni! I will be taking my business elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Rampley
Reviews.Content: The Omni was such a wonderful hotel! You just sank into the bed, the room had blackout drapes and the bathroom was like a small spa. The price was low in my opinion - I would have gladly paid more for the room! The only thing negative I have to say about the Omni is that we were the room right next to the elevators and you could hear them operating - not enough to keep us awake though. This is the only hotel we will stay at now when we are in the Dallas/Fort Worth area.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lani509
