Reviews.Content: I was very impressed by the service I recieved at this hotel. It was my birthday weekend and the staff went the extra mile to make me feel special. After dinner, we walked into my hotel and found a birthday cake slice! If that isn't knowing your customer, I'm not sure what is. The staff even gave suggestions on the activites to do around the area. They never appeared too busy to help or annoyed by any question. The room was very comfortable and had a nice view. What a bed! You just sink into it. Overall this is the best hotel I have booked, and I enjoy staying at high rated hotels. Also, the price was pretty good. The location was good because it is withen 15 minutes of most activites that I enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: PerfectPear
Reviews.Content: This was our wedding night and we could not have been more pleased with every aspect of this hotel. We reserved a "getaway" package (champagne, strawberries, breakfast) and the pricing was very reasonable. The champagne on ice and a beautifuly prepared plate of chocolate strawberries were waiting for us in our room when we checked in, along with a long stem rose on the bed and even ice in the water bucket (separate from the champagne ice bucket). Breakfast was elegantly delicious and our waitress was extremely efficient and charming. Every part of the staff was extremely courteous and seemed genuinly glad to serve us. This was a PERFECT stay, and a wonderful start to our marriage. The hotel and staff should be commended! Thank You Omni Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: smacks17
Reviews.Content: Met all my expectations. The hotel is in a good location-- short driving distance to restaurants and stores. The staff was very friendly. The only think I'll say that could use some improvement is that the sheets weren't too soft... huge bed though! :)

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: triportravel
Reviews.Content: I was not disappointed at the Omni. The staff was very helpful & courteous. I was in and out frequently and the concierege never missed a beat. The hotel itself is gorgeous not too much not too little. Only a few mins away from everything right off of I-635 (which takes u around the city). I stayed in a junior suite near the elevator (mistake) listened to the low humm of the elevators for four days . Besides that, the room was very nice, roomy, extremely clean, very comfortable bed, & very well decorated. Flat screens and personal safe. Side Note: loved the blackout curtains I'm an all nighter at 11:00 a.m. my room was as dark as 2:00am .The housekeepers were on point in the mornings and with turn down service. Didn't speak english though. Didn't eat at the restaurants. Or out of the in room fridge bit pricey one coke was two dollars and fifty cent a bottle of water six dollars. The wine (in room) was a five to ten dollar bottle priced at thirty. In comparison with the others at the same price this hotel was worth it. All of the accomodations of a four/five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service...Truly Pampered”
Reviews.Author: enjoyingmyfamily
Reviews.Content: I just got home from a fabulous stay at the Omni Park West in Dallas. We had the most wonderful time. I didn't want to go home it was soooo comfortable. We were pampered all weekend long. It was great. Breakfast was excellant and well worth the price. The room we stay in was spacious and clean. The flat screen tv was great and amenities was all we needed and more... They sent cookies and milk to the room for our little children (ages one and three) at bed time. The pool is gorgeous and the grounds are well maintained. We felt like a king and queen and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, but isolated and problem with min-bar charge”
Reviews.Author: robundle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is generally nice. On the plus side 1.The bedding is extremely comfortable. You will sleep well. 2.The hotel seems to be well made and it is quiet. 3.There is a nice pool. It is roomy and has little sprinklers that squirt out from one side. 4.There is lots of free parking. But, there are some negatives: 1. The hotel is isolated. You can not walk anywhere. If you try, you will probably get run over. The hotel does operate a shuttle, but it is on a first come, first serve basis. So, you can't reserve it for use. It's best to have a rental car if you stay at this place. There are plenty of restaurants a few exits down. 2. There is an expensive restaurant on the premises and also a bar with bar food. The bar food is for the most part not very healthy. 2. They spray a wierd fragrance in the lobby, I guess to create some ambience. It smells like a really strong, synthetic floral perfume. Yuck. 3. The hotel erroneously charged me for the mini-bar ($50.00.) I did not use the mini bar, so I am guessing that a hotel employee took stuff from the mini-bar and charged it to my room. I called the hotel and they apologized and said that I would be refunded. I did appreciate the quick response, but hey...I'm not used to having false charges on my credit card. I'm glad that I checked. All in all, it wasn't a bad stay. However, for the reasons above I would probably seek out another hotel next time in Dallas. If you have business in the area, it's probably a decent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel in a Flashy Town”
Reviews.Author: LIttleHoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Omni for 6 nights for a business trip. For someone who conducted all business activities inside the Omni for the entire week, I never got cabin fever. There is plenty to do: outdoor pool, bar, nice restaurants, gym, free wifi. The concierge know plenty about great things to do around the area so they can direct you should you leave the hotel. The rate was 110/night. Rooms are clean, with beautiful comforters, Institute Swiss toiletry, and flat screen tv. I was so pleased with the Omni that I booked a business trip just so I can stay at this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: Rhaggard
Reviews.Content: Came to Dallas for a weekend and wanted a nice, clean place to stay, choise the Omni after reading several good reviews. The property is wonderfully cared for, very clean, landscaped well, rooms are big, clean, all the furniture is nice. There is room service from the in-house restant, dine in or they will deliver to the pool side, the food was good. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, near the airport, 1 exit from McArthur exit which has all the popular eateries and stores, but far enough to not have the traffic congestion or noise. Located in north Dallas, only took 20 minutes to get to Fair Park area for a concert, and to Six Flags. This will be my hotel of choise for future trips to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Opulence”
Reviews.Author: KSnj
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I was put off by the opulence of the Omni's lobby. I was traveling on business and needed to get down to business, not fuss. The Omni will allow you to stay on course while pampering you along the way. Rooms are very well designed and appointed. Beds are comfortable. Bathroom is a nice size and shower is good. Fitness center is very well equipped. Parking is free. Dining at the hotel can get pricey but the food and service won't let you down. I really enjoyed my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “So nice”
Reviews.Author: RochesterAmy
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Omni was awesome. The front desk staff was extremely helpful will any questions we asked. The bell staff was very nice/helpful when I got sick and needed to go to the hospital. They quickly shuttled me there for free and were so nice. They even inquired about how I was feeling the next morning. Would definitely stay here for any future visits to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “B Day Trip”
Reviews.Author: IcebergSlim06
Reviews.Content: Since the first experience was extremely pleasant, we decided to try this location again for my birthday. After joining the Select Guest Program, we received a couple of coupons that we used that gave us some excellent rates for a 4 night B Day trip. When booking thru the 800 number, we were sort of talked into staying on the Club Floor (12th Floor) for the comp breakfast and cocktail hour. They made the room sound good even after they explained that it was significantly smaller than the exec suite we had on the last visit. The room was way too small!!! It felt like a closet!!! After a call to the front desk, I was quickly upgraded to a Park West Suite on the same floor. (Excellent service at front desk) First the cons: This hotel has a few issues with their climate control system. Same prob as my first review, however, the engineer came up and did something to make it work perfectly. Secondly, on this side of the hotel, the elevator was a bit noisy thru the walls... no biggie however! Lastly, The bed in this room was reported to be queen size... no sir!!! Full size maybe... but not a queen. No issue because it was extremely comfortable. The pros: After a few minutes of unpacking, room service sent up a birthday surprise that was deliciouso!!!! Again, the complimentary morning beverage service w/ newspaper is awesome... housekeeping was excellent as we left the room about 2pm each day to return to a fresh room. Overall, this was another good stay. Hopefully I can get into the Presidential Suite soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Omni Experience”
Reviews.Author: Pippsyo
Reviews.Content: We paid approx $110 per night and stayed for three nights. Really very happy there. The king room was clean, well designed, spacious. Flat high def TV, free internet and morning hot/cold drink (if you join their Select Guest program) was all great. Bed was very comfortable, slept very well. Fitness centre was useful and well-equipped. The small pool area with its fountain was very pleasant even if the Caribbean music on the speakers felt a bit optimistic. Anyhow it's nice if there's not a hurricane around. Parking is free. Concierges were very helpful printing out directions, front desk fine. Didn't eat at their restaurants. 20 minutes to downtown, 15 minutes drive from DFW airport, 3 minutes from a 17-screen cinema. All round fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: MJMH
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights recently at the Omni while I was attending a conference. I was given an executive suite on the 4th floor and the room was perfect. It was spacious, with separate sleeping and living areas. It was decorated stylishly and well-equipped with two flat-screen TVs, a desk, comfortable sofa etc. The staff I met were excellent. When checking in, the receptionist warned me my room was close to elevators and gave me an opportunity to swap rooms if I needed to. A nice, customer-friendly touch. I used room service on one of the nights I was there. It was Ok, nothing special, but the prices seemed typical for a hotel of this quality. I didn't try any of the hotel restaurants. The Omni is about 10 miles from downtown Dallas and access by car is easy as the hotel is situated close to the highway. DFW is also very close by.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: sdmamanda
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Omni for three nights for a wedding in Dallas. The price we got at the Omni ($99.00 a night) was a way better deal than the Hilton where other guets were staying. I was a little weary becaase of the price, so I went to Tripadvisor for...well, advice. Most of the comments on here are right on. It was well priced for what we got. The hotel has a restaurant, a bar, a wine bar w/ tapas, a snack shop, and a lovely pool with a great veranda to sit out of the sun by the pool. They even have a waitperson that comes by the pool to take drink/food orders. They also have room service. The rooms were fine. Everything seemed really new and clean. The windows don't open in the rooms, so that's one downfall. The only other one is the parking fee. It seems every hotel has one now, but compared to the Hilton's, it was $6 less (Omni's is $11 a night). OH, don't mention a car and express check-out?...you may not get charged the parking fee. Other than those two minor things, the hotel was wonderful. Even if you don't consider quality vs price, It's still a great hotel...and a great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FlyGirl25
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying with Omni hotels so I wasn't sure what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. Their turn down service includes a glass of milk and a big chocolate chip cookie. If you sign up for their reward program you also receive a complementary breakfast package that will either be left behind your door or someone will hand it to you personally. The bed was very comfortable and the room, in general, was fairly clean. The bathroom was a good size but the water flow wasn't the greatest. When I needed to have my stay extended I was moved into the presidential suite... mercy! It was huge and included a library, piano, dinining room area, bar, I think about 3 bathrooms and a sunk in tub. The decor was quite outdated but the room itself was very comfortable. My one complaint: when I made my reservation via telephone the staff kept me on hold for close to 25 minutes as they tried to find someone to handle reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: NorthEast33
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one Friday night when I messed up my reservation at the Omni Mandalay (just a few miles away) It turned out to be a great mistake. Not only did I received a $99 special, but this hotel is up to date and very very comfortable. Staff: Friendly and Helpful. Room: High Ceilings but the rooms were a bit small. Full floor to ceiling windows. No views, but those windows really impressed me since I was on a high floor. The room overall was small but for some reason I just loved the feel. Very contemporary w/o sacrificing comfort. In Room Dining: Large Selection. Some items were good others average. I didn't stay too long so I don't have much to review. I just really liked this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Plateglass
Reviews.Content: Large and upscale. Great room, King Bed and flat panel tv. Good sized bathroom. Got an excellent rate online which was about a third of the advertised rate. Very convenient for Dulles with an efficient shuttle service thrown in. Bar/Dining/Mini Bar etc all about what you'd expect from this class of hotel, eg-$6 for a beer. Overall recommended for business or leisure although the hotel obviously aims at the former. Would definitely stay here again, and thats even after tripping up getting out of the cab and spraining my thumb and grazing my knee. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the business traveler”
Reviews.Author: ibeplato
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights to attend some nearby business meetings. This is a top-notch hotel with excellent service, though an indoor pool would be a nice addition. The rooms were very nice with the usual amenities, plus high-definition wide-screen TV with a great selection of channels. Internet access was $9.95 a day, but worked fine. The breakfast buffet was fantastic, with a good variety and selection. There is also a nice lounge bar. The staff was wonderful as well. I'd highly recommend this hotel if your travels take you to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate/For Expense Accounts Only”
Reviews.Author: tea42California_USA
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weekend in October. While the room and service were adequate, management is pretty shameless in respect of the hidden charges. For example, one minute phone calls to another state are over 14 dollars per minute. The corporate room rate, charged to an AMEX, was significantly higher than the AMEX rate available for weekend stays booked directly on-line. Finally, fees for use of the business centre are astronomical and completely divorced from reality. They really take every possible advantage of the fact that there is nothing nearby. This is strictly a hotel for people on expense accounts.

Reviews.Title: “Needs better housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: mysterytour2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Omni and was a little disappointed by how thorough housekeeping was. Overall the room was nice and clean except that there was a used, dried up towel hanging on the back of the bathroom door and a used bar of soap in the shower. Upon checkout I mentioned this to the front desk and they were very apologetic and offered to buy me breakfast. BTW, I booked through Priceline and I would recommend that you request a room on an upper floor when you register. I took what they gave me and it was on the lowest floor. This is an atrium hotel and the noise of people talking at the restaurant or bar on the first floor is quite loud.

Reviews.Title: “The Omni Dallas Park West is an excellent business hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLooper
Reviews.Content: I had to travel to Dallas on business and this hotel was on my company's approved list to stay. I was very impressed by both the ambiance and quality of the hotel and the attention to detail. In my experience, this is one of the better hotels in Dallas. The most important element in any hotel is the comfort of the bed and it was excellent. They could use more variety in pillow fluffiness - some like their pillows hard and some like them soft - the Omni pillows tend to be on the soft side. Every other detail was fine. The bath towels were sumptuous and the room cleanliness was excellent. The staff was helpful and friendly. Bottom line - if you are visiting Dallas on business, the hotel is quiet, accommodating and very comfortable. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Omni”
Reviews.Author: sethlouis1
Reviews.Content: It was great...Righit off the highway..Easy check in..We called before to make sure we got exactly the room we wanted and if we could check in early and it was fine. There is a great breakfast which was free one of the days we stayed. Only two negatives were that there are no restarants close, dance clubs, etc. you have to drive for all that but eveything is not far. And it would have been great to have a microwave and small fridge. Other than that excellent. We will definately be back..

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: rbaron721
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas 2 weeks out of every month. I love the Omni. I can only afford to stay there every now and then when they are running specials. Sometimes I can get this place for $99- that's when I stay there. This is a 4-5 star hotel. The beds are very comfortable. The hotel is very very clean. Very decent pool and workout facilities. It sits right across the street from a large pond with a running track around the perimeter. The restaurants have excellent food for decent prices for Dallas. The lobby is decadent. The front desk attendants and the concierges are very nice and helpful as well as the valets. The bathrooms are very clean and well appointed. I like the shower because it is oversized and has good water pressure. They provide top of the line soap, shampoo and lotion. The mini-fridges are well stocked- try the chocolates. This is an excellent hotel for a romantic getaway, business trips, family trips, etc. This place is well-run and should be a model for the hotel industry.

Reviews.Title: “You will be a "prisoner" at a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: Corvette87
Reviews.Content: It is $ 35.00 taxi from FW/Dallas airport. I was there for four days for seminar. Hotel property is top notch. They come across as very elegant. Small things they do not do (fresh flowers) you would not notice if you have not stayed at Ritz or Westins. I considered my room smallish but well appointed. They have electrical outlet challenges. I rented microwave and had to put on floor and unplug lamp. Also coffee pot must be moved into bath. Staff is wonderful. Pool lovely and workout very nice. I found my bed a bit stiff and feather pillows too flat but these are very personal tastes. I was never made aware of any shuttle or I would have used it. Got three limo names from desk. I usually take one out for two hours in strange city to sight see. The min. was 4 at 85.00 per. I did not leave property as Dallas was 6 or so more miles away than airport and was not going to spend that much on taxi. Wish I had rental car!! There is only one restaurant and the food is great. The lunch buffet was 15 and well worth it. My room service was prompt and expensive as always. I could find no phone book but concierge had two pizza places that deliver. The gift shop is tiny but has most anything you might need. If you care they have starbucks. The bar is upscale and has tables el fresco over looking the pool which is nice spot at twilight. Weekend rates are a steal compared to simular properties in other cities. This would be a great place for romantic interlude. The bar has decent appetizers and will make stuff to go. Oh! I forgot one very pleasent moment. I was sunning myself and just about to go find a drink a lovely young man brout round a tray of plastic glasses filled with ice water with fresh lemons that really hit the spot!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: bobvron
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations after reading the reviews and ratings for this hotel, but I was disappointed. Our room was very dark and not laid out very well. The in room coffee was a joke as there is no place to plug it in and no coffee was provided. When I attempted to get a cup downstairs, the coffee shop was closed and no one seemed to know why. They just kept saying to check back later. Although my room was pre- paid 2 weeks in advance, when I checked out, I received no bill, and when I asked for one, they had charged my card again and couldn't figure out why. Not what I expected form a 4 star hotel and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Omni Hotel at Park West, Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ampmother
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 10th anniversary. Upon check-in, the front desk attendant asked where we were from & why we were in town. We told her we were from the area & just wanted a get-away to celebrate our anniversary. We went up to our room- beautiful amenities, comfortable bed. Shortly after we arrived, there was a knock at our door from room service. We had assumed it was a mistake-a bottle of wine & chocolate covered strawberries were delivered! The front desk attendant called to be sure we received our complimentary wine & strawberries & that we knew to use our breakfast coupon in the morning! It was a fabulous touch & we will definitely stay here again! All the staff was courteous & extremely professional.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice-Very Isolated”
Reviews.Author: justices
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni Park West for my wife's high school reunion. The room was large, clean, and very nicely furnished. The bedding was first rate.The flat screen hi def TV was great. This hotel makes its' living on parties and conventions. You'll see all types milling around the lobby. The check in and out was quick and efficent. The staff pleasent and helpful. The only negatives I had were the lack of room service or open hotel restaurants after 11:00PM and it was Saturday night. You could only get an $8 ham sandwich after 11. This was made worse by the fact that there are no restaurants of any type within 2 miles in any direction. The pool area is very nice. Free parking, free local newspapers, express elevators, and Starbucks on site are other nice pluses.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad experience with lost and found”
Reviews.Author: LSUGirl98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Omni for our anniversary getaway (we live in Dallas), as we have several times before at different Omni locations. Great value as long as you get a cheap online rate. Unfortunately, we had two negatives that have really overshadowed the good aspects. First, we were there on a Saturday evening and had just gotten into the pool when a manager-type came through and told us we needed to vacate the area for a private party! He told everyone (several families with very disappointed kids) that we could come back around 8p.m., after the party was over. We could not believe that they did not tell us at check-in that the pool would be off-limits during the prime evening hours. Secondly, we left two items behind after check-out, and it took us literally weeks to get the staff to check the lost and found items for us and call back. And when finally contacted, they were pretty curt, and reported that the items were not found, which is impossible. We really want to like this hotel, but we can't get past these two events.

Reviews.Title: “Stay With Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Texas George
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: as with all of my reviews, I rate the property to similar area facilities not class of hotel in one area vs. same class in another area. Located equidistant from Love or DFW airport the hotel is along a freeway with minimal facilities around the property. Cab ride from Love was $30.00. Single building, public areas are semi Roman in design. Small Gym and outdoor pool. There is a shuttle service available about $15.00 THE GOOD: Rooms were spacious with soft contemporary furnishings. Large 42â€� plasma t.v. Work desk with plugs for high speed and additional electric outlets at desk. Very nice bath with some granite. Bellman at door on arrival. Check in flawless. Sound proofing excellent. Never heard freeway noise (room on freeway) or neighbor. Great bedding. Breakfast buffet in the restaurant outstanding and a great value. Excellent cookies provided during breaks. Mini Bar service, daily paper. THE BAD: The food service provider for banquets should not be considered as a provider of a palatable source of food. THE UGLY: As there was a large (for this hotel) convention. The single in hotel restaurant was closed for a private party. Forced those without cars to eat snack food at the bar. No support facilities were noted nearby so if you arrive without a carâ€¦. BOTTOM LINE: This is a great business hotel. If I was passing through Dallas and needed an overnight, this hotel is an excellent value. The hotel seemed to perform flawlessly for the convention (except for the food) and is a very nice upscale, quiet facility.

HotelInfo.Name: Omni Dallas Hotel at Park West
HotelInfo.Address: 1590 LBJ Freeway, Dallas, TX 75234
